name: Custom order for Sue and Sophie
description:
Sophie's shopping £20
Two felt courses £40 x 2

name: Cushion Indian hand block printed strip or floral
description:
I can make these cushions to suit your tastes. The hand block printed stripe has some lovely irregularities which clearly show the hand of the maker - you can see where he went a bit awry when his concentration lapsed!. The floral cushions have a soft romantic look to them, I have a few in stock, but can make them to suit your colours 
16 inches square, with a duck feather cushion pad, they are hand quilted onto organic cotton wadding.

name: Workshop - Gees Bend Quilting 12th October 10.30am
description: In this workshop you will use fabric to explore colour and shape. With a simple technique you will learn how to make a piece of fabric for a bag or cushion cover. I developed this workshop after being insured by the women of Gees Bend in Alabama. I will tell you the history of these women and introduce you to a world of colour and imagination!

name: Workshop - stars cushion 26th october 10.30am
description:
Come to my workshop and make a nine patch cushion using this deceptively simple technique. 

Only basic sewing skills required, all materials provided, machines too, but do bring your own if you like using it. 

10% off cafe spend and free drinks refills for all course participants. 

Duck feather cushion pad available for a fiver.

name: Home is Where the Art is .... my journey into quilting
description:
As part of the exhibition in Cumbria in May/June 2013, I created a book describing my journey into quilting. 

Hand bound, with fabric scraps on most pages, it tells of my influences and passion for colour and hand stitching. 

I will make each order as it is placed and so each one will have different fabric scraps. Please say if you would like these to be pinned to the pages rather than glued, so you can remove them for your own use, otherwise I will glue them using fabric glue.

The original book has been edited to include a description of all the quilts I made for the exhibition along with the story behind each one. 
its about 30 pages at present, but I may edit it a bit more.
its an ever changing thing!

I will sign and number each copy - so you will have a unique record and a glimpse into my creative world.

please allow time for me to make your copy.

thanks!

options.name: Home is Where the Art is

name: Indian Block Printed Quilt no. One
description:
This quilt is made using the fabric i brought back from Rajasthan, hand block printed in a riot of colours. Lovely floral prints that are all wildly different and yet work so well together.
This is a random selection of all the prints I have. 
The wadding is amazing - a 50/50 blend of alpaca and cotton, it is light as a feather and warm as toast. This is a quilt to wrap yourself up in on a gloomy winters day and instantly feel transported to warmer brighter days.
1.5 m square
hand quilted with lots of colours of embroidery thread
the back is large squares of the same stuff, so it works from both sides.

all rolled and tied in a hand stitched tie of the same fabric. ready to go when you are!

free pick up at my Northumberland workshop

name: The Liberty Heirloom Quilt
description:
Over 100 Liberty lawn fabrics, many out of production. 100% silk wadding and hours and hours of hand stitching in jewel-like colours. All this makes  for a special quilt, a magnificent wedding gift, an anniversary present to top them all or, best of all, a treasured gift to that most important person - you! 

The design fades from pale pinks, blues and lilacs and spreads to darker and darker shades to the outer edges. 

about 80 inches square the backing is larger squares of blue Liberty. The binding is different on the from and back so that it works equally well on either side, again, hand stitched Liberty.

Each of my quilts has its own booklet explaining how and why I made it as i did. This completes a gift to treasure and enjoy. 

sent by recorded delivery, or free pick up at my workshop in Northumberland

(Third picture shows the work in progress at my workshop with that sumptuous silk wadding)

name: The 'use what you have' Quilt
description:
I have accumulated a lot of fabric over the years from various sources. It is all stored in what appears to be a haphazard fashion in my Whitfield Workshop, but I know what I’ve got. Enough blues and greens to create this riot of those colours. 

This one is ‘foundation pieced’ - I took strips of lightweight cotton six inches wide and stitched random blues or greens onto each one. Stitch one strip, iron it flat, stitch another and so on. 

I have a big ‘design board’ in my workshop, nothing fancy - just two sheets of polystyrene covered with plain fabric, onto which I can pin a work in progress. I pinned this one in a variety of ways and finally settled on this alternating pattern. 

The wadding is 100% organic cotton, the backing is a big piece of cotton fabric with a flower and dot design. 

I quilted this one along the seam lines of the blue and green joins. Then I decided to quilt at right angles to these lines. Three strands of embroidery thread in blues and greens of all shades. You would have to look hard to see the stitching on the front, but it makes a nice grid pattern on the back. 

48 inches by 68 inches

rolled and tied and ready to go

(The first picture shows this quilt at the design stage, in my workshop. In the second picture you see this quilt draped over the sofa (left) in the exhibition 'Home is where the art is' in Cumbria in may 2013)

name: Shirts Quilt
description:
I am a fan of Kaffe Fasset, his obsession with colour matches my own. 

This shirts quilt was featured in one of his many books. 

3 inch squares, fiddly little squares of old shirts collected over many years, with a flash of wild colour here and there. 

Backed with a white sheet which shows the colourful running stitches off in the lovely grid pattern that I love, the little flashes of coloured cottons lift this quilt out of the laundry basket and onto that child’s bed maybe? 

100% organic cotton wadding, size about 36” x 64”

name: Solid Squares Quilt
description:
The temptation to include printed fabrics was strong but I resisted. Am I glad i did! This bright colourful quilt simply zings with joy!
Made with a huge range of solid coloured cottons, this quilt is 'tied' with several colours of embroidery thread at the intersection with the squares.
50 inches by 68 inches. 
100% organic cotton wadding.
backed with a bold red cotton
this one would look amazing on the back of your sofa!
It would certainly cheer up a gloomy day!
rolled and tied with a matching tie, its ready for you when you are.

name: Indian Block Print Quilt no. two
description:
This is a quilt made from fabric I brought back from Rajasthan, from the factory in Sanganeer run by Ronnie, the ex Bollywood actor. 
This fabulous fabric is a riot of colours, the design is a simple square pattern that lets the fabric do the talking. 
Quilted with 100% organic cotton wadding, the reverse is nine big squares of the same fabric.
1.5 meters square, quilted in a grid design, by hand, using all colours of embroidery thread.
Rolled and tied with a tape made from the same fabric with little Indian beads on the ends.
Its all ready for you when you are!

(in the second picture it is the quilt unrolled on the back of the sofa - ooh!)

name: Fun Sewing Projects
description:
I have a couple of fun sewing projects to share with you

WORKSHOP ONE - Indian Window Hanging - using my delicious block printed fabric from India and the little beads and sequins I brought back from Rajasthan you will make a delightful window hanging 
(kits available in the shop if you can't make the course) 

WORKSHOP TWO - recycled fabric box - using old jeans and my huge stash of bling, embellishments and trimmings, come and make a fabric box. All materials provided, but you can use a pair of your old jeans for a more personal box. 

All materials provided, these workshops are offered for between 3 and 6 people at a time to suit you. (not Thursday, this is Open Workshop) 

10% off in the cafe, free drinks refills. 

please get in touch to arrange your workshop.

name: FELT
description:
Three different ways with colourful merino fibre
three different workshops for you to choose from

WORKSHOP ONE Felt for beginners - learn how wool fibre becomes felt with the addition of a bit of hot water and soap and hard work! 

WORKSHOP TWO 3D felt - make a small bag or purse using a process called 'resist felting' 

WORKSHOP THREE laminated felt - I think I made up this term, because I have not seen it elsewhere, you will make prefelts and use them to make a more detailed design than you can achieve using the basic wet felting method 


All these workshops can be taken at a time to suit you (except Thursdays which is Open Workshop at MAKE) 
With a minimum of three and a maximum of 6 people for this three hour (at least) workshop, just get in touch and we can organise a time to suit. 
10% off in the cafe, free drinks refills, all materials provided. 

a treat!

name: Voucher adult workshop £40
description:
Stuck for the perfect gift? Why not treat your loved ones to a workshop at MAKE? 
So many to choose from.
I can send you a card for you to give if you wish.  (either as an email or real card with stamp!)

name: BOOKS
description:
Three different ways to make books
Three different workshops for you to choose from

WORKSHOP ONE Japanese Stab Binding - This workshop is suitable for beginners, using recycled and decorative handmade papers we will make a Japanese Stab Bound Book

WORKSHOP TWO - Sewn Pages - Using recycled papers and some Indian and Thai handmade paper we will make a sewn book with signatures and a slip cover.

WORKSHOP THREE - Coptic bound books look tricky, but with a little concentration you will make a book with a flexible spine which opens flat - good to use as a sketch book. Using watercolour quality paper for the pages and decorated handmade papers for the covers, you will make a gorgeous sketch/note book.

All these workshops can be taken at a time to suit you (except Thursdays which is Open Workshop at MAKE) 
With a minimum of three and a maximum of 6 people for this three hour (at least) workshop, just get in touch and we can organise a time to suit. 
10% off in the cafe, free drinks refills, all materials provided.




Coptic bound books look tricky, but with a little concentration you will make a book with a flexible spine which opens flat - good to use as a sketch book. Using watercolour quality paper for the pages and decorated handmade papers for the covers, you will make a gorgeous sketch/note book. 

All materials provided. 10% off cafe and free drinks refills
For between 3 and 6 people, on a day to suit you (except Thursday which is Open Workshop) Please get in touch to arrange a suitable time. 

please contact for more informatiom

name: CRAFT PARTY just for you
description:
Be it a special birthday, for you or as a gift, a work-place 'away day' or just a need to make something with your friends, we can arrange for your needs here at MAKE. 
Have a look at the workshops we offer. Anything you like the look of? Discuss your needs with me and we'll design the party you'd like. 
From 4 people to about 8 or so. 
Tea/coffee provided

The cafe can cater for your event. Or you can take advantage of the 10% discount offered to all course participants on the day of your event and order from the menu.

name: Stiener Dolls made in India £22 LAST THREE BOYS LEFT!
description:
These dolls are made by Tibetan refugee women in a project in the north of India led by a German woman who was taught to make these beautiful Stiener influenced dolls by my friend Holly's Mum! 
Check out the web site (www.dolls4tibet.com) to find out more about this project
We are so lucky to be able to offer these wonderful dolls to you. Each one is unique, made with beautiful fabric and gorgeous wool hair. Stuffed with sheeps wool, these dolls are robust enough for some serious play. The clothes are removable, the dolls have such character. There are ONLY THREE boy dolls left!
